perturbation.original_text: Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they may apply for an arbitration in Miaoli County and the arbitration result shall be compulsory. II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding for revoking any arbitration result regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Miaoli District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.changed_text: Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they may apply for an arbitration, but the location and rules will be determined later. II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding for revoking any arbitration result regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Miaoli District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates arbitration in Miaoli County, making the arbitration result compulsory. The modified clause introduces uncertainty by stating that the location and rules of the arbitration will be 'determined later'. This weakens the enforceability of the arbitration clause, as it leaves key aspects undefined, potentially allowing a party to challenge its validity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwan Arbitration Act (introduces uncertainty in mandatory clauses)

perturbation.original_text:
Article IV. Service Fee

The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total and the fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring shall be calculated based on the ratio of 3.50% of the legal construction cost hereof. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in Party B; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra service fee.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article IV. Service Fee

The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total. The fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring may or may not be calculated based on a mutually agreed-upon ratio. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in Party B; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra service fee, unless otherwise negotiated.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stipulates that fees for planning, design, and construction monitoring 'shall be calculated' based on a fixed ratio (3.50% of the legal construction cost). This is a clear and defined term. The modified clause changes this to 'may or may not be calculated based on a mutually agreed-upon ratio,' introducing ambiguity. The original clause requires Party A to bear extra service fees for modifications, while the modified clause allows for negotiation against it.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law Principles (ambiguity in financial terms)

perturbation.explanation: The original clause states Party B 'shall make the most economical and effective arrangement,' implying a commitment. The modified clause weakens this to Party B 'shall attempt to make an arrangement,' reducing the obligation. Additionally, the original clause states that the following timelines are 'the term planned'. Adding that the timings are 'an estimate' adds ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law Principles (vagueness regarding project timelines)
